required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Performance of a Transcutaneous Bone Conduction Hearing Solution (Baha® Attract System)
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Performance of a Transcutaneous Bone Conduction Hearing Solution (Baha® Attract System). A Multicentre, Open, Prospective Clinical Investigation. 3 Months Investigation With a 6 Months Follow-up

brief_summary.textblock:
The rationale behind this clinical performance investigation is to collect data regarding the usability of the Baha Attract System in patients with hearing impairment that are candidates for Baha surgery:
- To describe the expected hearing performance with the Baha Attract in comparison to unaided hearing thresholds or a pre-test situation using a sound processor together with a softband
- Which sound processor to select, i.e. BP100 vs BP110
- Improve the fitting process for the sound processor
- Selection of sound processor magnet at time of fitting and over time

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 12 weeks after surgery
primary_outcome.description: The change in pure-tone thresholds in free field measured by the difference in pure tone average PTA4 (Mean of thresholds at 500, 1000, 2000 and 4000 Hz) from the pre-operative unaided condition to the aided situation with the Baha Attract System at week 12.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 36 weeks after surgery
primary_outcome.description: The change in pure-tone thresholds in free field measured by the difference in pure tone average PTA4 (Mean of thresholds at 500, 1000, 2000 and 4000 Hz) from the pre-operative unaided condition to the aided situation with the Baha Attract System at week 36.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 36 weeks after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The change in pure-tone thresholds in free field measured by the difference at individual frequencies from the pre-operative unaided condition to the aided situation with the Baha Attract System at week 36.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hearing Performance, PTA4, Sound Processor on Softband Versus Baha Attract at 36 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 36 weeks after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The change in pure-tone thresholds in free field measured by the difference in pure tone average PTA4 (Mean of thresholds at 500, 1000, 2000 and 4000 Hz) from the pre-operative aided situation with the Sound Processor on a softband to the aided situation with Baha Attract System at week 36.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hearing Performance, Individual Frequencies, Sound Processor on Softband Versus Baha Attract at 36 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 36 weeks after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The change in pure-tone thresholds in free field measured by the difference in hearing levels of individual frequencies from the pre-operative aided situation with the Sound Processor on a softband to the aided situation with Baha Attract System at week 36.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hearing Performance, Speech in Quiet, Unaided Versus Baha Attract at 36 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 36 weeks after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The change in hearing performance, speech in quiet from the pre-operative unaided condition to the aided situation with the Baha Attract System at week 36.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hearing Performance, Speech in Quiet, Aided With the Sound Processor on a Softband Versus Baha Attract at 36 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 36 weeks after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The change in hearing performance, speech in quiet from the pre-operative aided situation with the Sond Processor on a softband to the aided situation with the Baha Attract System at week 36.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hearing Performance, Speech in Noise, Unaided Versus Baha Attract at 36 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 36 weeks after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The change in hearing performance, speech in noise from the pre-operative unaided condition to the aided situation with the Baha Attract System at week 36.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hearing Performance, Speech in Noise, Aided With the Sound Processor on a Softband Versus Baha Attract at 36 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 36 weeks after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The change in hearing performance, speech in noise from the pre-operative aided situation with the Sond Processor on a softband to the aided situation with the Baha Attract System at week 36.

secondary_outcome.measure: Abbreviated Profile of Hearing Aid Benefit (APHAB)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 36 weeks after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Change of APHAB scoring from the unaided pre-operative situation to the aided situation with Baha Attract at 36 weeks. APHAB questionnaire is a 24-item self-assessment inventory that evaluates the benefit experienced by the patient when using hearing amplification compared to the unaided situation. APHAB produces a Global score and scores for four subscales: ease of communication (EC), reverberation (RV), background noise (BN), and aversiveness (AV). The absolute APHAB scale is between 0 and 100%, where 0% indicates no problem and 100% indicates always problem. The change from unaided to aided hearing is presented. A positive value indicates an improvement, a negative value an impairment. This scale applies to all reported scores.

other_outcome.description: Surgical thinning of the soft tissue flap was advocated when the soft tissue thickness exceeded 6 mm.
Implant Stability Quotient - ISQ, a scale from 1 to 100, where 100 represent the highest stability.
Type of sound processors BP100 and BP110 attached to a soft band (subject preference)

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 12 weeks after surgery
other_outcome.description: Difference between softband measurement at visit 1 and measurement with the Baha Attract system at visit 6. Feedback is a measure of how much sound from the actuator (vibrator) returns to the microphones thus creating a loop of sound which sounds like high pitch noise. Measuring this is a part of the performance of the system, i.e how much gain can the sound processor produce before feedback occurs. Unit of measure is dB re output. A negative value of the change means less feedback.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 12 weeks after surgery
other_outcome.description: Difference between softband measurement at visit 1 and measurement with the Baha Attract system at visit 6. Feedback is a measure of how much sound from the actuator (vibrator) returns to the microphones thus creating a loop of sound which sounds like high pitch noise. Measuring this is a part of the performance of the system, i.e how much gain can the sound processor produce before feedback occurs. Unit of measure is dB re output. A negative value of the change means less feedback.
To investigate if the magnetic force required for sound processor magnet retention will change over time
Evaluation of the skin using the Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale (POSASa scale from 1 (normal skin) to 10 (worst scar imaginable).
Evaluation of neuropathic pain or pain in the scar the last week by asking the patients to rate their experience on a scale from 1 (no, not at all) to 10 (yes, very much).
Evaluation of numbness by asking the patients if they had experienced any numbness within 2 cm from the centre of the implant magnet or within and beyond 2 cm from the centre of the implant magnet.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Conductive hearing loss in the implanted ear. Bone conduction thresholds with a pure tone average of 500, 1000, 2000 and 3000 Hz <30 decibel (dB) hearing level (HL)
- Single-sided Sensorineural Deafness (SSD). Bone conduction thresholds with a pure tone average of 500, 1000, 2000 and 3000 Hz <30 dB hearing level (HL) in the best ear
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled diabetes as judged by the investigator
- Condition that could jeopardize osseointegration and/or wound healing, e.g. osteoporosis, psoriasis and use of corticosteroids
- Unable to follow investigational procedures, e.g. to complete quality of life scales
- Less than 4mm of soft tissue pre-operatively
- Participation in another investigation with pharmaceuticals and/or device
- Condition that may have an impact on the outcome of the investigation as judged by the investigator
- Subjects that have received radiation therapy at the same side of the skull where the Baha Attract will be positioned
- Suitable implant position for the Baha BI300 implant system (4 mm and 3 mm) not found during surgery due to insufficient bone quality and/or bone thickness

overall_official.affiliation: The HEARing CRC & HearWorks, University of Melbourne

facility.name: The HEARing CRC & HearWorks, University of Melbourne
The Chinese University of Hong Kong

results_reference.citation: Briggs R, Van Hasselt A, Luntz M, Goycoolea M, Wigren S, Weber P, Smeds H, Flynn M, Cowan R. Clinical performance of a new magnetic bone conduction hearing implant system: results from a prospective, multicenter, clinical investigation. Otol Neurotol. 2015 Jun;36(5):834-41. doi: 10.1097/MAO.0000000000000712.

group.title: Baha Attract System
group.description: This transcutaneous solution is based on a magnet coupling using magnets on both side of the skin; One implant magnet One external magnet on which a sound processor is attached, i.e. the Sound Processor magnet (SP magnet) Baha Attract System

group.title: Baha Attract System

outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 12 weeks after surgery
outcome.population: Intention-to-Treat (ITT) population, includes all patients who received surgical intervention.

outcome.title: Abbreviated Profile of Hearing Aid Benefit (APHAB)
outcome.description: Change of APHAB scoring from the unaided pre-operative situation to the aided situation with Baha Attract at 36 weeks. APHAB questionnaire is a 24-item self-assessment inventory that evaluates the benefit experienced by the patient when using hearing amplification compared to the unaided situation. APHAB produces a Global score and scores for four subscales: ease of communication (EC), reverberation (RV), background noise (BN), and aversiveness (AV). The absolute APHAB scale is between 0 and 100%, where 0% indicates no problem and 100% indicates always problem. The change from unaided to aided hearing is presented. A positive value indicates an improvement, a negative value an impairment. This scale applies to all reported scores.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 36 weeks after surgery
outcome.population: Intention-to-Treat (ITT) population, includes all patients who received surgical intervention.

APHAB produces a Global score and scores for four subscales: ease of communication (EC), reverberation (RV), background noise (BN), and aversiveness (AV). The absolute APHAB scale is between 0 and 100%, where 0% indicates no problem and 100% indicates always problem. The change from unaided to aided hearing is presented. outcome.title: Feedback Measurement, BP100
outcome.description: Difference between softband measurement at visit 1 and measurement with the Baha Attract system at visit 6. Feedback is a measure of how much sound from the actuator (vibrator) returns to the microphones thus creating a loop of sound which sounds like high pitch noise. Measuring this is a part of the performance of the system, i.e how much gain can the sound processor produce before feedback occurs. Unit of measure is dB re output. A negative value of the change means less feedback.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery and 12 weeks after surgery
outcome.population: Intention-to-Treat (ITT) population, includes all patients who received surgical intervention.

group.title: Baha Attract System
group.description: This transcutaneous solution is based on a magnet coupling using magnets on both side of the skin; One implant magnet One external magnet on which a sound processor is attached, i.e. the Sound Processor magnet (SP magnet) Baha Attract System

measure.description: Difference between softband measurement at visit 1 and measurement with the Baha Attract system at visit 6. Feedback is a measure of how much sound from the actuator (vibrator) returns to the microphones thus creating a loop of sound which sounds like high pitch noise. Measuring this is a part of the performance of the system, i.e how much gain can the sound processor produce before feedback occurs. Unit of measure is dB re output. A negative value of the change means less feedback.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.organization: The HEARing CRC & Hearworks, Audiology Hearing and Speech Science, Melbourne, Australia
